about_the_game:
Lords of Nysera is a Tactical RPG inspired by games like Fire Emblem 4, Shining Force, Final Fantasy Tactics, and D&D. As the player, you will recruit beautifully rendered characters each with rich personalities, thoughtful story arcs and unique abilities to aid you in battle.



We have a growing community where we discuss the game, report bugs and celebrate hobbies, talents and gaming in general. Join now to hear the news and meet some absolutely wonderful folks.



  • A phase-based tactical system of combat, where each team takes turns moving troops and taking actions to accomplish goals.
  • Flexible playstyles, with players able to use Diplomacy, Stealth, Aerial Combat, Area of Effect Abilities, and Terrain-Altering magic to accomplish their goals.
  • A detailed Campaign with numerous side quests and dungeons to explore.
  • Alternative story paths. Whichever Lord the player chooses to lead the army will determine objectives and alter the course of the war.
  • A Beautiful Soundtrack of over 30 music themes, composed by the wonderful artist, Adam Bow, maker of the soundtrack for Death and Taxes, and other successful games.
  • Over 30 unique, playable characters, each with their own story to tell, grudges to settle and partners to romance.
  • 50 different classes, with special promotions, abilities, skills and specializations to utilize in battle.
  • Hundreds of items and spells lovingly pixeled by hand. Discover crafting recipes, upgrade your equipment, and harvest rare materials from the earth.
  • A thoroughly built world, with a diverse races, complex histories and numerous mysteries to unravel.

  • Numerous terrain altering spells that allow you to cross rivers, create impassable walls, blinding storms and thickets of razor sharp vines.
  • An advanced aerial combat system, where flyers can ascend to a second map to face of against airborne threats.
  • Pseudo-2D terrain, where castles and other guarded structures give boosts to ranged units and prevent melee attacks.
  • Structures which can be destroyed, repaired and bolstered to stave off enemy siege equipment.
  • 12 elements of magic which can be researched to devastate enemies, raise morale, or provide powerful buffs and debuffs.
  • Command cohorts of recruits which follow unique leader units into battle. Cohorts will keep formation so long as their morale remains intact!

Other Features

content_descriptors.notes: Lords of Nysera deals with some elements of discrimination, prejudice and racism in a fantasy setting. None of these instances are intended to reflect real-world issues, but some may be upsetting to individuals.
